$!You must tell DVLA if you have schizophrenia.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in the M1 questionnaire and send it to DVLA - the address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘M1 - Medical questionnaire’ (PDF, 252KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066650.pdf "Download ‘M1 medical questionnaire’ (PDF, 252KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You must tell DVLA. Fill in the M1V questionnaire and send it to DVLA - the address is on the form. 

$D
[Download ‘M1V - Medical questionnaire’ (PDF, 243KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_172725.pdf "Download ‘M1V medical questionnaire’ (PDF, 243KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D



*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: Schizophrenia is a medical condition you must tell DVLA about
title: Schizophrenia and driving
